page.title: 06Transport Services
page.content: This year the station at Carnoustie was closed.It is now an un-manned stopping point for trains.It is used regularly by commuters who are travelling to work in Dundee and Arbroath.In the summer,more people use the train for pleasure. Buses are another way of travelling out of Carnoustie.They are more help- ful for people who live or work in the small villages such as Monikie which lie to the north of Carnoustie.The services are quite regular but the journeys sometimes take quite a while because of the stops for passengers. For shorter journeys taxis can be used.There are three different taxi services in Carnoustie.About 60% of the people in Carnoustie use them. (However more people use buses.) The busiest time for taxi-drivers is during Christmas and New Year.
